summary: Communities that get help from the Federal Emergency Management Agency after disasters generally have to share project costs. They can use disaster recovery and mitigation grants from the Department of Housing and Urban Development to help pay their portion. Grantees plan to do this with 7% of the $49.4 billion in HUD grants for disasters that happened January 2017–January 2023. But HUD grants and FEMA...
title: Disaster Recovery: Use of HUD Block Grant Funds to Meet Cost-Share Requirements
